page.title: 07Education in Brereton.
page.content: There are two main schools and a Play- school in the Brereton area.There is a private school for girls called {Brereton Hall}which as the name suggests is housed in the old Hall.The Hall was built in 1586 for the Brereton family.The house survived many vicissitudes until 1939 when a new phase in its life began.A party of school children were brought to stay from the bombed centre of Manchester, and Brereton Hall School was born. {The village school}was built in about 1833 for the church.There were two classrooms and an adjoining house for the Headteacher.Today the school has been extensively extended,now containing seven classrooms and a large assembly hall.At one time the school housed 250 pupils,it now has 90 children on roll. The catchment area stretches for a radius of about 3miles
